    • Method Detail

      • getResourceBundle

        public java.util.ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
        A ResourceBundle is only needed when the language is not English. Getting the bundle too early will result in an error (because there is no resource bundle for English, so it is better to only get the bundle when we actually need it, which is after we know the language ia not English.
        Returns:

      • logLoginAttempt

        public void logLoginAttempt​(java.lang.String userData)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        When called, will log any string passed as the parameter. Called in the submitLogin button event handler to log the user data that is attempting to log in.
        Parameters:
        userData -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Displays an error if the DB doesn't return a user.
        Parameters:
        currentUser - - this is the Users object returned from the DB
        Returns:

      • validatePassword

        public boolean validatePassword​(Users currentUser,
                                java.lang.String user,
                                java.lang.String pass)
        Checks if the username entered matches the username entered, and if so, checks if the associated password is the correct one for that username. If it is not, it returns an error.
        Parameters:
        currentUser -
        user -
        pass -
        Returns:

      • submitLogin

        public void submitLogin​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        Handles the submit button event, where user data is validated and the user is passed on to the main view. Also initiates the login log.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException
